message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.CE, cs.SY 

This paper discusses the concept of life as an informational phenomenon and how it can be quantified at different levels of organization, from molecules to global ecological systems. This topic is highly interdisciplinary and could potentially fit into several arXiv CS sub-categories. 

Firstly, cs.IT (Information Theory) is a likely category as the paper discusses the concept of information processing and quantification. Secondly, cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) could also be a possible category as the paper discusses the creation of mutual context and the generation of persistent consequences, which are relevant to network analysis. 

Thirdly, cs.LG (Machine Learning) could be a relevant category as the paper discusses the filtration and synthesis of information at different levels to appear in complex systems, which is similar to the concept of hierarchical learning. Fourthly, cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science) could be a possible category as the paper discusses the integration of life at all scales with the physical universe, which could be relevant to computational science and engineering. 

Finally, cs.SY (Systems and Control) could also be a possible category as the paper discusses the overall function of information processing, which is to perpetuate itself, and how this can be observed at different levels of organization, which is relevant to systems and control theory.
